definition: cold weather, frozen ground (idiom); bitterly cold
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly

sentences.english: In December, we must wear heavy clothes when go out since it is clod at that time.
sentences.chinese: 十二月天寒地冻，所以我们穿上厚重的衣服外出。

sentences.english: Enduring the cold and also the flu.
sentences.chinese: 忍受着天寒地冻，也忍受着流感。

sentences.english: In the season that the day freezes coldly, the hair was become sweet brittle article.
sentences.chinese: 天寒地冻的季节里，头发成了娇滴滴的易碎品。

sentences.english: And for very very freezing cold days.
sentences.chinese: 如果是天寒地冻的天气。

sentences.english: In the freezing weather, the snow-covered cottage appears even shabbier.
sentences.chinese: 天寒地冻，覆雪的小屋显得更加贫穷。

sentences.english: She bundled herself up in several warm sweaters before going out into the freezing cold.
sentences.chinese: 外面天寒地冻，她外出前套了几件暖和的毛线衣。

definition: a world of ice and snow
nine periods of nine days each after winter solstice, the coldest time of the year
The north wind is icy cold.
to freeze/to feel very cold/aspic or jelly
